forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 60. West southwest wind around 9 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 69, with temperatures falling to around 67 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
A gentle breeze accompanies the shroud of cloud cover that tucks San Francisco into a cool embrace this early morning. The air, stillous and soothing, recalls the comforts of early autumn, as the temperature hovers delicately around sixty degrees. As dawn breaks and the city stirs to life, a hint of clarity emerges, promising a transition into a mostly sunny Saturday. Throughout the day, warm sunlight will weave in and out of the cloudy tapestry, peaking at a leisurely sixty-nine degrees before settling back to a cozy sixty-seven by the afternoon.

The west-southwest winds, stretching from gentle whispers to playful gusts, will invigorate the day, teasing soft ripples through the leaves and the skimming clouds above. Fog, while present through the night, begins retreating as the sun's warmth melds with the coolness of the sea, allowing views of the Golden Gate and the city skyline to sharpen. Attire for the day should balance comfort and adaptability; perhaps a light jacket for the morning chill and layers beneath for the sunshine that lies ahead. Given these amiable conditions, a stroll along the waterfront or a visit to one of the city’s parks might be a refreshing way to soak in the cradling embrace of a quintessential San Francisco day.
